top_comment.text:
People who say Chris Hemsworth is boring in interviews... i just- I don't 
understand them! He's soo funny and seems like such a fun guy to have 
around. Even though I love Tom Hiddleston (he's such a respectful and 
amazing dude), and I also adore loki so much (as you can tell from my 
profile picture), I actually think it's Tom that's pretty boring. He says 
the same things in all interviews and repeats the words/phrases 
"enormously", "entertained", "never in my wildest dreams" "extordinary" etc.
Tom is a VERY good actor, but I feel like he's way too overated and Chris 
is very underated. If fans just took the time to notice how he acts in the 
movies, as much as they do with Tom, all the attention would be directed 
towards him.﻿

The best dream I ever had: On the day that Thor: The Dark World was coming 
out I woke up and saw that Chris Hemsworth was living in my family room as 
a guest. He was the most chill guy in the world and was super funny with 
everything that he did, and then he dropped me off at school and I got to 
brag to my friends about him. Later on that day we went to go watch the new 
Thor movie with some of my friends and afterwards we played videogames 
together. He was like an older brother to me. Then I woke up and I told my 
friends and they made fun of me for having a dream about a muscular guy and 
I made fun of them for not having a dream where Chris Hemsworth was like 
their older brother.﻿

captions.text:
- YOUR BROTHER IS AN ACTOR
AS WELL, LIAM.

AND THEN YOU HAVE
ANOTHER BROTHER

YEAH, MY OLDER BROTHER
LUKE STARTED,

AND THEN WE KIND OF FOLLOWED
HIS FOOTSTEPS.

- THAT'S A GOOD-LOOKING FAMILY
RIGHT THERE.

THAT'S A GOOD-LOOKING GROUP
OF BOYS.

- GOT A COUPLE
OF ACTING CLASSES

AND THEN WE KIND OF EACH
KIND OF FOLLOWED EACH OTHER.

YEAH, YOU MAKE IT
SOUND REAL EASY,

BUT THEN YOU GET
FROM THERE TO HERE

AND I DIDN'T KNOW THIS,
BUT I READ THIS--

THAT YOU BOTH ACTUALLY
WERE UP FOR THE ROLE OF THOR.

AND THEN YOU WERE HELPING HIM
GET THE ROLE.
I HAD AN AUDITION BEFORE LIAM,
AND I DIDN'T GET A CALLBACK.

- AND THEN, LIKE,
A MONTH LATER,

LIAM CALLED ME UP
AND SAID,

"OH, I'M DOWN TO THE FINAL
FOUR PEOPLE OR WHAT HAVE YOU."

AND I SAID, "COOL, I'LL HELP YOU
WITH THE AUDITION."

AND BOYCOTTED
THAT AUDITION, OF COURSE.
AND HE DIDN'T GET THE PART,

AND THEN I, YOU KNOW,
GOT IN.

BUT, NO, IT WAS A STRANGE
KIND OF TEAM EFFORT,

AND WE'RE COMPETITIVE,
I THINK, IN EVERYTHING

YOU KNOW, THIS TENDS
TO BE THE INSANITY

AND THE CONSISTENCY OF IT,
YOU KIND OF--

YOU'RE NEVER IN DIRECT
COMPETITION ANYWAY.

- AND NOW, HE IS OLDER
OR YOUNGER THAN YOU?

- AND HE SEEMS TO GET LOTS
AND LOTS OF ATTENTION

OF A RELATIONSHIP
THAT HE'S BEEN IN.

- YOU DON'T HAVE THAT KIND
OF PAPARAZZI FRENZY

AROUND YOU RIGHT NOW,
DO YOU?

I MEAN, I'VE SPOKEN
TO A FEW PEOPLE ABOUT IT,

AND YOU--I DON'T KNOW
THAT YOU CAN EVER--
IT SORT OF IS WHAT IT IS,

AND THERE ARE TIMES
YOU'RE A TARGET

AND IF YOU HAVE A FILM COMING
OUT OR WHATEVER

OR WHO YOU'RE DATING
AND WHAT HAVE YOU.

MY WIFE AND I,
WE KIND OF LIVE

A PRETTY SIMPLE,
BORING KIND OF LIFE.

WE'RE NOT ROLLING OUT OF CLUBS
AT 4:00 IN THE MORNING.

NOT TO SAY LIAM IS,
BY THE WAY.

- I MEAN, HE HAS ONCE
OR TWICE.

- SO YOUR WIFE IS AN ACTRESS
AS WELL.

AND YOU HAVE
A ONE-YEAR-OLD BABY?

- AND HOW--WELL,
THAT KEEPS YOU HOME ANYWAY.

- OH, YEAH,
IT KEEPS YOU BUSY.

AND SHE HAS THIS THING OF
KIND OF KICKING ME IN THE HEAD,

I LIE NEXT TO HER,
AND IT'S JUST,

YOU KNOW, AND--BUT EVERYTHING
SHE GRABS A HOLD OF

IS JUST ABOUT DESTROYING IT
AND...

SHE'S WELL-BEHAVED,
BUT SHE'S SO PHYSICAL.

EVERYTHING SHE DOES
IS KIND OF LIKE--

YOU KNOW, SHE'LL JUMP
ON MY HEAD,

AND, YOU KNOW, THINKS
IT'S REALLY FUNNY,

LIKE, JUST BY KICKING ME
IN THE FACE.

- SHE SHOULD NOT HURT
THAT FACE.

DO NOT LET HER HURT
THAT FACE.

- ALL RIGHT, WE'LL TAKE
A BREAK,

AND WE'LL TALK ABOUT THE MOVIE,
WHICH IS REALLY GOOD.

WHICH, YOU KNOW,
KIND OF COVERS UP YOUR BODY.
WHEN YOU ARE IN A CAR AGAIN,

YOU DON'T NEED
THE WHOLE FULL-BODY SUIT.

- THAT WAY YOUR ARMS ARE OUT
AND YOUR LEGS ARE OUT.

- LOOK HOW--LOOK HOW BREATHABLE
THAT THING IS.

SO YOU CAN WEAR THIS
ON THE WAY HOME IF YOU WANT.

I'LL WEAR IT ON THE SHOW
NEXT TIME.

- WELL, PUT IT ON.
WE'LL WATCH YOU LEAVE TODAY.

ALL RIGHT, "RUSH"
IS IN THEATERS SEPTEMBER 27TH.

title: Chris Hemsworth on His Brother Liam
